# NSTextList.MarkerFormat

**Structure**

Constants that describe marker symbols you can apply to list elements in text lists.

## Declaration

```swift
struct MarkerFormat
```

## Overview

Select a marker symbol to apply to your list elements in your text list, then set it in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextList/markerFormat-swift.property]. Or, specify a marker symbol when you create a text list with [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextList/init(markerFormat:options:)] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextList/init(markerFormat:options:startingItemNumber:)].

## Selecting a marker format

- **box**: The value that represents a square-shaped marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **check**: The value that represents a checkmark-shaped marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **circle**: The value that represents a circle-shaped marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **decimal**: The value that represents a decimal annotation marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **diamond**: The value that represents a diamond-shaped marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **disc**: The value that represents a disc-shaped marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **hyphen**: The value that represents a hyphen-shaped marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **lowercaseAlpha**: The value that represents a lowercase localized alphabetical marker you that can apply to a text list item.
- **lowercaseHexadecimal**: The value that represents a lowercase hexadecimal (base 16) numerical marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **lowercaseLatin**: The value that represents a lowercase Latin alphabetical marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **lowercaseRoman**: The value that represents a lowercase Roman numeral marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **octal**: The value that represents an octal (base 8) numerical marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **square**: The value that represents a square-shaped marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **uppercaseAlpha**: The value that represents an uppercase localized alphabetical marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **uppercaseHexadecimal**: The value that represents an uppercase hexadecimal (base 16) numerical marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **uppercaseLatin**: The value that represents an uppercase Latin alphabetical marker that you can apply to a text list item.
- **uppercaseRoman**: The value that represents an uppercase Roman numeral marker that you can apply to a text list item.

## Initializing a marker format

- **init(_:)**: Creates a new marker that you can apply to an item in a text list with the raw value you provide.
- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates a new marker that you can apply to an item in a text list using the string you provide.

## Working with markers

- **markerFormat**: Returns the marker format string used by the receiver.
- **marker(forItemNumber:)**: Returns the computed value for a specific ordinal position in the list.

## Conforms To

- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
